page.title: 09CRAFT AND INDUSTRY _FOXTON
page.content: The industry and crafts of our area are influenced by the location and land use in the main and therefore tend to be based on serving the farms or the canal. Canal craft is the art of making things for the narrowboats.The materials used are Tin,Galvanised sheet and wood.Normal gloss paint is used to decorate the items made.The products made to_day are replicas of the original canal items such as tin buckets,kettles,pots and pans,fancy painted tillers and deck fittings.It is the occupation of some and a hobby of others.The items are bought both by the tourists and boat_people. The other main industry is the repair and building of boats carried out at Foxton Locks Basin.
